lead_paragraph: LUBELL--Daniel. Renowned Bankruptcy Lawyer Dies at 59. An attorney for some of the high-profile bankruptcy cases of our times, Dan died on February 19th at his home in Short Hills, New Jersey, with his wife and sons by his side. The cause was brain cancer. For 28 years, he worked in Corporate Reorganization for Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP, and for a year and a half in Bankruptcy & Restructuring at Locke Lord LLP. His premature death comes as a blow. Warm, spirited, compassionate, fiercely intelligent, Danny was beloved by all. A tough negotiator, Dan represented Lehman Brothers and MF Global under the Securities Investor Protection Act and built a diverse book of clients. Born in Brooklyn on March 7, 1956, a fraternal twin, he grew up in Bellmore, New York. A high school and college wrestling champion, he graduated from UCLA cum laude and attended Boston University School of Law, an editor of BU Law Review, graduating magna cum laude. In New York, Danny met his wife of 28 years, Eugenia Teterskis. They had two children and lived in Short Hills, where Dan played an active community role, mentoring a youth group at Summit Unitarian Church. World traveler, supporter of the arts, passionate professional, devoted husband and father, an all-around wonderful man, Dan's survivors: Eugenia; sons Sasha (26), Nicholas (24); brothers, Eric, Richard, and William; and parents, Ileane and Arthur Lubell. The memorial service will be April 2nd, Unitarian Church, Summit, NJ. 1/3
